item.description: Notes on Polynomial Interactive Oracle Proofs (Draft) # Encoding Arrays of Data into Polynomials # Data starts as a array of integers where integers in each slot are between 0 and $q-1$, where $q$ is a large (generally 256 bit) prime number. Recall that we call this set of integers $\mathbb{Z}_q$. $\mathsf{data}_0$ $\mathsf{data}_1$ $\mathsf{data}_2$ $\mathsf{data}_3$ $\mathsf{data}_4$ It is common to denote a polynomial like $P(X)$ where $X$ is the variable of the polynomial.
